root.name: textureMode()
root.description: Sets the coordinate space for texture mapping. There are two options, IMAGE, which refers to the actual coordinates of the image, and NORMALIZED, which refers to a normalized space of values ranging from 0 to 1. The default mode is IMAGE. In IMAGE, if an image is 100 x 200 pixels, mapping the image onto the entire size of a quad would require the points (0,0) (0,100) (100,200) (0,200). The same mapping in NORMAL_SPACE is (0,0) (0,1) (1,1) (0,1).
